intro: Pteropogon ramosissimus, commonly known as the hairy pogostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
